result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Alphonse Kneepkens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Court ordered restitution in the amount of $475.00 payable to Robert Haack Diamonds by 10/10/2021. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 10/10/2018, or serve 10 days in the House of Correction.
*Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Consecutive to: To 13CF53 and any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Kathleen A. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x25480805 in court 1x on 10/10/16.
Witness fee request prepared for Kathleen A. was approved for 1 appearance on 10/10/16 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request prepared for Kathleen A. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 2:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to 13CF53 and any other sentence.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 10/10/2018, or serve 10 days in the House of Correction.  

Court ordered restitution in the amount of $475.00 payable to Robert Haack Diamonds by 10/10/2021. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.   

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Michael Alphonse Kneepkens in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Count 2:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

As to Count 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Michael Alphonse Kneepkens not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, defense requests a jury trial date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 47.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce from Oshkosh Correctional.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Michael Alphonse Kneepkens not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 47.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Michael Alphonse Kneepkens not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense is not prepared to proceed with the plea and sentencing this morning.  Matter adjourned to 1:30 pm same day.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Michael Alphonse Kneepkens not in court, in custody in another county.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to defendant's pending cases   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Michael Alphonse Kneepkens not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Michael Alphonse Kneepkens not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Alphonse Kneepkens in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Michael Alphonse Kneepkens in custody.  
Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk:  sm

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47 due to a Lower Penidng Case.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  

Status conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
